text: how do you install multiple custom fonts in a child-theme ? My theme is only able to pick one font and not the second one from theme.json
AFAIK the formatting is correct but there’s no documentation on the tilda
Hey Jason. I’m currently looking at your support ticket from the HubSpot engineering side. It should be `"zip_code="~contact.zip~"&limit=3"`
ah! perfect timing! i will try that :slightly_smiling_face:
when i choose a contact with a zipcode it’s not propagating the code
the ~contact.zip~ looks right as only one `~` will error in the module, so looks like we definitely need two
What do you get with `{{projects|pprint}}` after this screen shot

I think targeting by section/column is tricky in case anyone ever adds anything new. The negative margins can be confusing for non-developer content editors but at least you can find that.

I wish you could add CSS to the editor too, but one cool thing I've learned is that, while you can't add a CSS class to a dnd_section in a template, if you create a "Section" file (templateType: section) you can add a CSS class to the dnd_section. So you could create a reusable section called "Form with overlap" and add that class.

The problem there is that you can only have one dnd_section per Section file, so you can't add in the part below.

So I still think just negative margins is the way to go
Ooh, that is a good idea with the sections. I'm going to try that for custom elements. I agree with you about the negative margins. Easy peasy.

you can define as many fonts as you want in the CSS using @fontface, but you'll only be able to control the one defined in the theme via the theme settings, any of the other fonts you load would have to be controlled via CSS only
Sure, just add it to blog-post.html or similarly make a custom module which the client can control the visibility of, in said template
